body.p: To his Excellency Governor Thos E Bramlett

Your Petitioner John Hagans Respectfully States that at the September Term of the Magoffin Circuit Court 1863 that there was a Judgement rendered in Said Court in favor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky and against your Petitioner John Hagans for the sum of ($7800) seventy eight dollars and cost of the proceeding in Said Court, Said fine was rendered against your Petitioner Hagans under these circumstances (viz)

Your Petitioner made application to the county court of Magoffin County for a change in the Public highway runing ^on the land^ near the mansion of Said Hagans, and the court awarded him an order to make Said change, He immediately proceeded to make Said change in the said road and in making the same he run his fense across the old road before the viewers of said road filed their report to the court State that after Said road was completed Said County Court refused to accept the same and the county attorney told your Petitioner that if he would make a small change at the lower end of said road that then the court would receive the same which your Petitioner immediatelty done and thought that said road was received by said Court according to the contract entered into by the attorney for the county and this Petitioner

Your Petitioner Hagans believed that he would have no further difficulty about Said road and he says that he was ignorant of the law in such cases and placed implicit confidence in the county attorney Statements and from the statements of the attorney for the county, he thought nomore about said road believeing that it was all fixed up according to the laws of the country, he therefore asks your Excellency to remit said fine of $7800 and that all officers and persons be prohibited from the collection of the same

The under Signed Petitioners Joins in the prayer with said Hagans for the remission of said fine, and asks your Excellency to remit said fine and that all persons be prohibited and restrained from the collection of the same, they state that said Hagans, like many others is tolerably poor

Wherefore they pray as above & will forever pray for the remision of said fine
Dec 20th 1863.

J. E. Cooper
Wallis Baley, Clk. M. C. C
B F Howard Ds M. Co
R L Cooper
Isaac C. Howard
Thomas B Cooper
Stepton ^his X mark^ Arnett
Havila Cook
Joshua Kays
W H Harris
John Samuels
James Gutter
Isieh Salyer
Richard Whitt
Solomon C Bently
If Your Excellency has the kindness to Remit fine Send the same to MountSterling Ky care of J W Hazelrigg as there is no mails coming to my county yours very Respectfully

Magoffin Cir Ct
vs
John Hagans

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
